q: Who was the first Governor-General of India?
desc: The Charter Act of 1833 made Lord William Bentinck the first Governor-General of India.

q: Which act made Lord William Bentinck the first Governor-General of India?
desc: The Charter Act of 1833 changed the title from Governor-General of Bengal to Governor-General of India.

q: Which social evil was prohibited in 1829 during Bentinck’s tenure?
desc: The practice of Sati was banned by Lord William Bentinck in 1829.

q: Under whose recommendation was English made the medium of higher education?
desc: English was made the medium of higher education on the recommendations of Thomas Macaulay.

q: Who is known as the liberator of the press in India?
desc: Lord Metcalfe is called the liberator of the press for removing restrictions on the press in 1835.

q: Which Governor-General was associated with the disastrous First Afghan War?
desc: Lord Auckland led the British into the First Afghan War (1838–42), which ended disastrously.

q: Who ended the First Afghan War?
desc: Lord Ellenborough ended the disastrous First Afghan War during his tenure.

q: Which Governor-General oversaw the annexation of Sind?
desc: The annexation of Sind was carried out by Charles Napier under Lord Ellenborough’s term.

q: Which war was fought during Lord Hardinge's term?
desc: The First Anglo-Sikh War (1845–46) occurred under Lord Hardinge.

q: What treaty concluded the First Anglo-Sikh War?
desc: The Treaty of Lahore in 1846 ended the First Anglo-Sikh War.

q: Which Governor-General introduced the Doctrine of Lapse?
desc: Lord Dalhousie used the Doctrine of Lapse to annex several princely states.

q: Which of the following states was annexed in 1848 under Doctrine of Lapse?
desc: Satara was the first state annexed under the Doctrine of Lapse in 1848.

q: Which state was annexed in 1856 due to maladministration?
desc: Awadh was annexed in 1856 by Lord Dalhousie on grounds of maladministration.

q: When was the first railway line in India laid?
desc: The first railway line was laid between Bombay and Thane in 1853.

q: Which cities were connected by the first telegraph line in India?
desc: The telegraph line between Calcutta and Agra was introduced under Dalhousie.

q: When was the first Indian postage stamp issued?
desc: The first Indian postage stamp was issued in Karachi in 1854.

q: Who was the driving force behind the Widow Remarriage Act of 1856?
desc: Ishwar Chandra Vidyasagar was instrumental in the passing of the Widow Remarriage Act of 1856.

q: Which act introduced competitive exams for Civil Services in India?
desc: The Charter Act of 1853 introduced competitive examinations for recruitment into the civil services.

q: Which Governor-General initiated the Grand Trunk Road development?
desc: Lord Dalhousie started the development of the Grand Trunk Road and Public Works Department.

q: Which summer capital of British India was established by Lord Dalhousie?
desc: Lord Dalhousie made Shimla (Simla) the summer capital of British India.

q: Which city saw the issue of the first Indian postage stamp?
desc: The first Indian postage stamp was issued in Karachi in 1854.

q: Which institution was started by Dalhousie for technical education?
desc: Lord Dalhousie started the Engineering College at Roorkee, one of India’s first technical institutions.

q: Which port cities were developed under Lord Dalhousie?
desc: Lord Dalhousie developed major ports like Calcutta, Bombay, and Karachi.

q: What did Lord Bentinck do to suppress crime?
desc: Lord Bentinck eliminated the Thugs, a criminal group, in the 1830s.

q: What practice did Bentinck try to suppress besides sati?
desc: Bentinck also took steps to suppress female infanticide and child sacrifice.

q: Which Governor-General gave preference to English-educated Indians in employment?
desc: Lord Hardinge preferred employing English-educated Indians during his administration.

q: Which war was fought under Lord Ellenborough in 1843?
desc: Lord Ellenborough fought the war with Gwalior in 1843.

q: Who annexed Jhansi under Doctrine of Lapse?
desc: Jhansi was annexed by Lord Dalhousie in 1853 under the Doctrine of Lapse.

q: Who annexed Nagpur under the Doctrine of Lapse?
desc: Nagpur was annexed in 1854 under the Doctrine of Lapse by Lord Dalhousie.
